BP.term: positive regulation of tyrosine phosphorylation of STAT protein

name: TNF receptor superfamily member 18
other_names: tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily member 18

pid.name: Downstream signaling in naïve CD8+ T cells

reactome.name: RUNX1 and FOXP3 control the development of regulatory T lymphocytes (Tregs)

summary: This gene encodes a member of the TNF-receptor superfamily. The encoded receptor has been shown to have increased expression upon T-cell activation, and it is thought to play a key role in dominant immunological self-tolerance maintained by CD25(+)CD4(+) regulatory T cells. Knockout studies in mice also suggest the role of this receptor is in the regulation of CD3-driven T-cell activation and programmed cell death. Three alternatively spliced transcript variants of this gene encoding distinct isoforms have been reported. [provided by RefSeq, Feb 2011].
